00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 Applet.pl - Provides code for inserting FlashApplets and JavaApplets into webwork problems
00020 
00021 =head1 SYNPOSIS
00022 
00023   ###################################
00024   # Create  link to applet 
00025   ###################################
00026  $appletName = "PointGraph";
00027 $applet =  FlashApplet(
00028    codebase              => findAppletCodebase("$appletName.swf"),
00029    appletName            => $appletName,
00030    appletId              => $appletName,
00031    setStateAlias         => 'setXML',
00032    getStateAlias         => 'getXML',
00033    setConfigAlias        => 'config',
00034    answerBoxAlias        => 'answerBox',
00035    submitActionScript    => qq{ getQE('answerBox').value = getApplet("$appletName").getAnswer() },
00036 );
00037 
00038 ###################################
00039 # Configure applet
00040 ###################################
00041 
00042 #data to set up the equation
00043 $applet->configuration(qq{<XML expr='(x - $a)^3 + $b/$a * x' />});
00044 # initial points
00045 $applet->intialState(qq{<XML> </XML>});
00046 ###################################
00047 #insert applet into body
00048 ###################################
00049 
00050 TEXT( MODES(TeX=>'object code', HTML=>$applet->insertAll(
00051   includeAnswerBox => 1
00052   debug=>0,
00053   reinitialize_button=>1,
00054  )));
00055 
00056 
00057 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00058 
00059 This file provides an object to store in one place
00060 all of the information needed to call an applet.
00061 
00062 The object FlashApplet has defaults for inserting flash applets.
00063 
00064 =over
00065 
00066 =item *
00067 
00068 =item *
00069 
00070 =back
00071 
00072 (not yet completed)
00073 
00074 The module JavaApplet has defaults for inserting java applets.
00075 
00076 The module Applet stores common code for the two types of applet.
00077 
00078 =head1 USAGE
00079 
00080 These modules are activate by listing it in the modules section of global.conf and rebooting the server.
00081 The companion file to this one is macros/AppletObjects.pl
00082 
00083 qw(Applet FlashApplet JavaApplet)
00084 
00085 =cut
00086 
00087 
00088 
00089 package Applet;
00090 
00091 use URI::Escape;
00092 
00093 
00094 
00095 use MIME::Base64 qw( encode_base64 decode_base64);

00097 
00098 =head2 Default javaScript functions placed in header
00099 
00100 =pod
00101 
00102 These functions are automatically defined for use for 
00103 any javaScript placed in the text of a PG question.
00104 
00105     getApplet(appletName)     -- finds the applet path in the DOM
00106 
00107     submitAction()            -- calls the submit action of the applets
00108 
00109     initializeWWquestion()    -- calls the initialize action of the applets
00110 
00111     getQE(name)               -- gets an HTML element of the question by name
00112                                  or by id.  Be sure to keep all names and ids
00113                                  unique within a given PG question.
00114 
00115     getQuestionElement(name)  -- long form of getQE(name)
00116 
00117     listQuestionElements()    -- for discovering the names of inputs in the 
00118                                  PG question.  An alert dialog will list all
00119                                  of the elements.
00120                                  
00121         Usage: Place this at the END of the question, just before END_DOCUMENT():
00122 
00123                 TEXT(qq!<script> listQuestionElements() </script>!);
00124                 ENDDOCUMENT();
00125              to obtain a list of all of the HTML elements in the question
00126     
00127     ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00128     
00129     
00130     List of  accessor methods made available by the FlashApplet class:
00131         Usage:  $current_value = $applet->method(new_value or empty)
00132         These can also be set when creating the class -- for exampe:
00133              $applet = new FlashApplet( 
00134                        # can be replaced by $applet =FlashApplet() when using AppletObjects.pl
00135                        codebase   => findAppletCodebase("$appletName.swf"),
00136                        appletName => $appletName,
00137                        appletId   => $appletName,
00138                        submitActionAlias => 'checkAnswer',
00139             );
00140 
00141 
00142         appletId     for simplicity and reliability appletId and appletName are always the same
00143         appletName
00144         archive      the name of the .jar file containing the applet code
00145         code         the name of the applet code in the .jar archive
00146         codebase     a prefix url used to find the archive and the applet itself
00147         
00148         params       an anonymous array containing name/value pairs 
00149                      to configure the applet [name =>'value, ...]
00150                      
00151         width        rectangle alloted in the html page for displaying the applet
00152         height
00153 
00154         bgcolor      background color of the applet rectangle
00155         
00156         header       stores the text to be added to the header section of the html page
00157         object       stores the text which places the applet on the html page
00158 
00159 
00160         configuration  configuration contains those customizable attributes of the applet which don't 
00161                      change as it is used.  When stored in hidden answer fields 
00162                      it is usually stored in base64 encoded format.
00163         initialState  the state consists of those customizable attributes of the applet which change
00164                      as the applet is used by the student.  It is stored by the calling .pg question so that 
00165                      when revisiting the question the applet will be restored to the same state it was 
00166                      left in when the question was last viewed.
00167                      
00168         getStateAlias  (default: getState) alias for command called to read the current state of the applet.
00169                        The state is passed in plain text xml format with outer tags: <xml>....</xml>
00170         setStateAlias  (default: setState) alias for the command called to reset the  state of the applet.
00171                        The state is passed in plain text in xml format with outer tags: <xml>....</xml>
00172 
00173         configAlias   (deprecated) -- a synonym for configAlias
00174         
00175         getConfigAlias (default: getConfig) -- retrieves the configuration from the applet.  This is used
00176                      mainly for debugging.  In principal the configuration remains the same for a given instance
00177                      of the applet -- i.e. for the homework question for a single student.  The state however
00178                      will change depending on the interactions between the student and the applet.
00179         setConfigAlias (default: setConfig ) names the applet command called with the contents of $self->config
00180                      to configure the applet.  The parameters are passed to the applet in plain text using <xml>
00181                      The outer tags must be   <xml> .....   </xml>
00182 
00183 
00184         initializeActionAlias  -- (default: initializeAction) the name of the javaScript subroutine called 
00185                                   to initialize the applet (some overlap with config/ and setState
00186         maxInitializationAttempts -- (default: 5) number attempts to test applet to see if it is installed.
00187                                      If isActive() exists then the WW question waits until the return value is 1 before
00188                                      calling the applet's confguration commands.
00189                                      Because some applets have isActive return 0 even when they are ready, 
00190                                      if isActive() exists but does not return 1 then the applet's configuration commands
00191                                      are called after maxInitializationAttempts number of times.  If none of the configuration commands
00192                                      of the applet can be detected then the WW question gives up after maxInitializationAttempts.
00193                                      
00194         submitActionAlias      -- (default: getXML) applet subroutine called when the submit button of the
00195                                   .pg question is pressed.
00196         submitActionScript     -- (default: qq{ getQE('answerBox').value = getApplet("$appletName").getAnswer() },
00197         
00198         answerBoxAlias         -- name of answer box to return answer to: default defaultAnswerBox 
00199         returnFieldName        -- (deprecated) synonmym for answerBoxAlias
00200        
00201        
00202         debugMode              (default: 0) for debugMode==1 the answerBox and the box preserving the applet state 
00203                                between questions are made visible along with some buttons for manually getting the state of
00204                                the applet and setting the state of the applet.
00205                                
00206                                for debugMode==2, in addition to the answerBox and stateBox there are several alerts 
00207                                which mark progress through the procedures of calling the applet.  Useful for troubleshooting
00208                                where in the chain of command a communication failure occurs
00209 
00210        
00211    Methods:
00212        
00213         insertHeader          -- inserts text in header section of HTML page 
00214         insertObject          -- inserts <object></object> or <applet></applet>  tag in body of the HTML page
00215         insertAll             -- (defined in AppletObjects.pl) installs applet by inserting both header text and the object text
00216             Usage:    $applet->insertAll(
00217                               includeAnswerBox     => 0,
00218                               debugMode            => 0,
00219                               reinitialize_button  =>0,
00220                       );
00221 
00222 
00223 =cut
00224 
00225 =head4 More details 
00226 
00227 There are three different "images" of the applet.  The first is the java or flash applet itself.  The object that actually does the work.
00228 The second is a perl image of the applet -- henceforth the perlApplet -- which is configured in the .pg file and allows a WeBWorK question
00229 to communicate with the applet.  The third image is a javaScript image of the applet -- henceforth the jsApplet which is a mirror of the perlApplet
00230 but is available to the javaScript code setup and executed in the virtual HTML page defined by the .pg file of the WeBWorK question. One can think of 
00231 the jsApplet as a runtime version of the perlApplet since it can be accessed and modified after the virtual HTML page has been created by 
00232 the PG rendering process.
00233 
00234 The perlApplet is initialized by   $newApplet = new flashApplet( appletName=>'myApplet',..... ); The jsApplet is automatically defined in 
00235 ww_applet_list["myApplet"] by copying the instance variables of $newApplet to a corresponding javaScript object.  So  $newApplet->{appletName}
00236 corresponds to ww_applet_list["myApplet"].appletName.  (This paragraph is not yet fully implemented :-().
00237 
00238 Currently all messages read by the applet are xml text.  If some of the code needs to be printed in the HTML header than it is converted
00239 to a base64 constant and then converted back to text form when it is read by a javaScript subroutine.
00240 
00241 The perlApplet has  methods that help place the jsApplet code on the HTML page and create the link to the applet itself. 
00242 In particular instance variables such as "setStateAlias", "getStateAlias" connect the WW default of "setState" to subroutine
00243 name chosen by the applet designer.  The aim is to make it easier to connect to applets previously designed to work 
00244 with javaScript in an HTML page or other  systems.
00245 
00246 
00247 The jsApplet acts as an intermediary for commands directed at the applet.  
00248 It is not necessary for the minimal operations of 
00249 configuring the applet and maintaining
00250 state from one viewing of the WW question to address the applet directly.  
00251 The methods such as "setState", "getState", "setConfig" which are part of the jsApplet 
00252 take care of the book keeping details.
00253 It is also possible to make direct calls to the applet from handcrafted javaScript subroutines, 
00254 but it may be convenient to store these as additional methods in the
00255 jsApplet. 
00256 
00257 =cut
00258 
00259 =head4 Detecting that the applet is ready
00260 
00261 Timing issues are among the pitfalls awaiting when using flash or java applets in WW questions.  It is important that the WW question
00262 does not issue any commands to the applet until the applet is fully loaded, including the uploading of any additional configuration
00263 information from XML files.  This can be tricky since the timing issues usually don't arise when initiating the applet from an HTML page.
00264 
00265 The WW API performs the following actions to determine if the applet is loaded:
00266 
00267     check the ww_applet_list[appletName].isReady flag (1== applet is ready)
00268                         -- this caches the readiness information so that it doesn't 
00269                            have to be repeated within a given viewing of a WW question
00270                            If this is 1 then the applet is ready.
00271     determine whether the applet's isActive subroutine is defined AND returns 1 when called. 
00272                         -- if the return value is 1 the applet is ready, if it is zero or no response then the applet is NOT ready
00273                         -- If the applet has an isActive() subroutine -- there is no alias for this --
00274                            then it must return 1 as soon as the applet is ready.  Otherwise
00275                            the applet will timeout.
00276     determine whether the applet's setConfig subroutine is defined. 
00277                         -- applet.{setConfigAlias}.  
00278     determine whether the applet's setState subroutine is defined.  
00279     determine whether the  jsApplets ww_applet_list[appletName].reportsLoaded flag is set to 1
00280                         -- this can be set by the applet if it calls the javaScript function 
00281                            "applet_loaded(appletName, loaded_status).  The loaded_status is 1 or 0
00282                            
00283     Logic for determining applet status: if any one of the above checks succeeds (or returns 1) then the applet is 
00284                           consdered to be ready  UNLESS the isActive() exists and the call returns a 0 or no response. In this case 
00285                           the applet is assumed to be loading additional data and is not yet ready. 
00286                           
00287                           For this reason if the isActive subroutine
00288                           is defined in the applet it must return a 1 once the applet is prepared to accept additional commands.
00289                           (Since there are some extent flashApplets with non-functioning isActive() subroutines a temporary workaround
00290                            assuems that after C<maxInitializationAttempts> -- 5 by default -- the applet is in fact ready but the 
00291                            isActive() subroutine is non functioning.  This can give rise to false "readiness" signals if the applet
00292                            takes a long time to load auxiliary files.)
00293 
00294 The applet itself can take measures to insure that the setConfig subroutine is prepared to respond immediately once the applet is loaded.
00295 It can include timers that delay execution of the configuring actions until all of the auxiliary files needed by the applet are loaded.
00296 
00297 
00298 =cut
00299 
00300 
00301 
00302 
00303 =head4 Instance variables in the javaScript applet   ww_applet_list[appletName]
00304 
00305        Most of the instance variables in the perl version of the applet are transferred to the javaScript applet
00306        
00307 =cut
00308 
00309 
00310 =head4 Methods defined for the javaScript applet   ww_applet_list[appletName]
00311 
00312 This is not a comprehensive list
00313 
00314     setConfig         -- transmits the information for configuring the applet
00315     
00316     getConfig         -- retrieves the configuration information -- this is used mainly for debugging and may not be defined in most applets
00317     
00318     
00319     setState          -- sets the current state (1) from the appletName_state HTML element if this contains an <xml>...</xml> string
00320                       -- if the value contains <xml>restart_applet</xml> then set the current state to ww_applet_list[appletName].initialState
00321                       -- if the value is a blank string set the current state to ww_applet_list[appletName].initialState
00322     
00323     
00324     getState          -- retrieves the current state and stores in the appletName_state HTML element.
00325     
00326     
00327 =cut
00328 
00329 =head4 Requirements for applets
00330 
00331 The following methods are desirable in an applet that preserves state in a WW question.  None of them are required.
00332 
00333     setState(str)   (default: setXML)  
00334                        -- set the current state of the applet from an xml string
00335                        -- should be able to accept an empty string or a string of
00336                           the form <XML>.....</XML> without creating errors
00337                        -- can be designed to receive other forms of input if it is 
00338                           coordinated with the WW question.
00339     getState()      (default: getXML)
00340                        -- return the current state of the applet in an xml string.
00341                        -- an empty string or a string of the form <XML>.....</XML> 
00342                           are the standard responses.
00343                        -- can be designed to return other strings if it is 
00344                           coordinated with the WW question.
00345     setConfig(str) (default: setConfig) 
00346                        -- If the applet allows configuration this configures the applet
00347                           from an xml string
00348                        -- should be able to accept an empty string or a string of the 
00349                           form <XML>.....</XML> without creating errors
00350                        -- can be designed to receive other forms of input if it is 
00351                           coordinated with the WW question.
00352     getConfig      (default: getConfig) 
00353                        -- This returns a string defining the configuration of the 
00354                           applet in an xml string
00355                        -- an empty string or a string of the form <XML>.....</XML> 
00356                           are the standard responses.
00357                        -- can be designed to return other strings if it is 
00358                           coordinated with the WW question.
00359                        -- this method is used for debugging to ensure that 
00360                           the configuration was set as expected.
00361     getAnswer      (default: getAnswer)
00362                        -- Returns a string (usually NOT xml) which is the 
00363                           response that the student is effectvely submitting to answer
00364                           the WW question.
00365 
00366 
00367 =cut
00368 
00369 =head4 Initialization sequence
00370 
00371 When the WW question is loaded the C<initializeWWquestion> javaScript subroutine calls each of the applets used in the question asking them
00372 to initialize themselves.
00373 
00374 The applets initialization method is as follows:
00375                    
00376                        -- wait until the applet is loaded and the applet has loaded all of its auxiliary files.
00377                        -- set the debugMode in the applet
00378                        -- call the setConfig  method in the javaScript applet  -- (configuration parameters are "permanent" for the life of the applet
00379                        -- call the setInitialization method in the javaScript applet -- this often calls the setState method in the applet                      
00380 
00381 =cut
00382 
00383 
00384 =head Submit sequence
00385 
00386 When the WW question submit button is pressed the form containing the WW question calles the javaScript "submitAction()" which then asks
00387 each of the applets on the page to perform its submit action which consists of 
00388 
00389     -- if the applet is to be reinitialized (appletName_state contains <xml>restart_applet</xml>) then 
00390        the HTML elements appletName_state and previous_appletName_state are set to <xml>restart_applet</xml>
00391        to be interpreted by the next setState command
00392     -- Otherwise getState() from the applet and save it to the  HTML input element appletName_state
00393     -- Perform the javaScript commands in .submitActionScript (default: '' )
00394        a typical submitActionScript looks like getQE(this.answerBox).value = getApplet(appletName).getAnswer()  )
00395 
00396 =cut
00397 
00398 
00399 sub new {
00400      my $class = shift; 
00401      my $self = { 
00402         appletName  => '',
00403         appletId    => '',   #always use identical applet Id's and applet Names
00404         archive     => '',
00405         code        => '',
00406         codebase    => '',
00407         params    =>undef,
00408         width     => 550,
00409         height    => 400,
00410         bgcolor   => "#869ca7",
00411         type      => '',
00412         visible   => 0,
00413         configuration      => '',         # configuration defining the applet
00414         initialState       => '',         # initial state.  
00415         getStateAlias      =>  'getXML',
00416         setStateAlias      =>  'setXML',
00417         configAlias        =>  '',        # deprecated
00418         getConfigAlias     =>  'getConfig',
00419         setConfigAlias     =>  'setConfig',
00420         initializeActionAlias => 'setXML',
00421         maxInitializationAttempts => 5,   # number of attempts to initialize applet
00422         submitActionAlias  =>  'getXML',
00423         submitActionScript  => '',        # script executed on submitting the WW question
00424         answerBoxAlias     =>  'answerBox',
00425         answerBox          =>  '',        # deprecated
00426         returnFieldName    => '',         # deprecated
00427         headerText         =>  DEFAULT_HEADER_TEXT(),
00428         objectText         => '',
00429         debugMode          => 0,
00430         selfLoading        => 0,
00431         @_,
00432     };
00433     bless $self, $class;
00434     $self->initialState('<xml></xml>');
00435     if ($self->{returnFieldName} or $self->{answerBox} ) { # backward compatibility
00436         warn "use answerBoxAlias instead of returnFieldName or answerBox";
00437         $self->{answerBox}='';
00438         $self->{returnFieldName}='';
00439     }
00440     if ($self->{configAlias}) { # backward compatibility
00441         warn "use setConfigAlias instead of configAlias";
00442         $self->{configAlias}='';
00443     }
00444     $self->configuration('<xml></xml>');
00445     return $self;
00446 }
00447 sub appletId {  
00448     appletName(@_);
00449 }
00450 sub appletName {
00451     my $self = shift;
00452     $self->{appletName} = shift ||$self->{appletName}; # replace the current appletName if non-empty
00453     $self->{appletName};
00454 }
00455 sub archive {
00456     my $self = shift;
00457     $self->{archive} = shift ||$self->{archive}; # replace the current archive if non-empty
00458     $self->{archive};
00459 }
00460 sub code {
00461     my $self = shift;
00462     $self->{code} = shift ||$self->{code}; # replace the current code if non-empty
00463     $self->{code};
00464 }
00465 sub codebase {
00466     my $self = shift;
00467     $self->{codebase} = shift ||$self->{codebase}; # replace the current codebase if non-empty
00468     $self->{codebase};
00469 }
00470 sub params {
00471     my $self = shift;
00472     if (ref($_[0]) =~/HASH/) {
00473         $self->{params} = shift;
00474     } elsif ( !defined($_[0]) or $_[0] =~ '') {
00475         # do nothing (read)
00476     } else {
00477         warn "You must enter a reference to a hash for the parameter list";
00478     }
00479     $self->{params};
00480 }
00481 
00482 sub width {
00483     my $self = shift;
00484     $self->{width} = shift ||$self->{width}; # replace the current width if non-empty
00485     $self->{width};
00486 }
00487 sub height {
00488     my $self = shift;
00489     $self->{height} = shift ||$self->{height}; # replace the current height if non-empty
00490     $self->{height};
00491 }
00492 sub bgcolor {
00493     my $self = shift;
00494     $self->{bgcolor} = shift ||$self->{bgcolor}; # replace the current background color if non-empty
00495     $self->{bgcolor};
00496 }
00497 
00498 sub  header {
00499     my $self = shift;
00500     if ($_[0] eq "reset") {  # $applet->header('reset');  erases default header text.
00501         $self->{headerText}='';
00502     } else {    
00503         $self->{headerText} .= join("",@_);  # $applet->header(new_text); concatenates new_text to existing header.
00504     }
00505     $self->{headerText};
00506 }
00507 sub  object {
00508     my $self = shift;
00509     if ($_[0] eq "reset") {
00510         $self->{objectText}='';
00511     } else {    
00512         $self->{objectText} .= join("",@_);
00513     }
00514     $self->{objectText};
00515 }
00516 sub configuration {
00517     my $self = shift;
00518     my $str = shift;
00519     $self->{configuration} =  $str   || $self->{configuration}; # replace the current string if non-empty
00520     $self->{configuration} =~ s/\n//g;
00521     $self->{configuration};
00522 }
00523 
00524 sub initialState {
00525     my $self = shift;
00526     my $str = shift;
00527     $self->{initialState} = $str   ||$self->{initialState}; # replace the current string if non-empty
00528     $self->{initialState};
00529 }
00530 
00531 sub getStateAlias {
00532     my $self = shift;
00533     $self->{getStateAlias} = shift ||$self->{getStateAlias}; # replace the current contents if non-empty
00534     $self->{getStateAlias};
00535 }
00536 
00537 sub setStateAlias {
00538     my $self = shift;
00539     $self->{setStateAlias} = shift ||$self->{setStateAlias}; # replace the current contents if non-empty
00540     $self->{setStateAlias};
00541 }
00542 
00543 sub getConfigAlias {
00544     my $self = shift;
00545     $self->{getConfigAlias} = shift ||$self->{getConfigAlias}; # replace the current contents if non-empty
00546     $self->{getConfigAlias};
00547 }
00548 sub setConfigAlias {
00549     my $self = shift;
00550     $self->{setConfigAlias} = shift ||$self->{setConfigAlias}; # replace the current contents if non-empty
00551     $self->{setConfigAlias};
00552 }
00553 
00554 sub initializeActionAlias {
00555     my $self = shift;
00556     $self->{initializeActionAlias} = shift ||$self->{initializeActionAlias}; # replace the current contents if non-empty
00557     $self->{initializeActionAlias};
00558 }
00559 sub maxInitializationAttempts {
00560     my $self = shift;
00561     $self->{maxInitializationAttempts} = shift || $self->{maxInitializationAttempts};
00562     $self->{maxInitializationAttempts};
00563 }   
00564 sub submitActionAlias {
00565     my $self = shift;
00566     $self->{submitActionAlias} = shift ||$self->{submitActionAlias}; # replace the current contents if non-empty
00567     $self->{submitActionAlias};
00568 }
00569 sub submitActionScript {
00570     my $self = shift;
00571     $self->{submitActionScript} = shift ||$self->{submitActionScript}; # replace the current contents if non-empty
00572     $self->{submitActionScript};
00573 }
00574 
00575 sub answerBoxAlias {
00576     my $self = shift;
00577     $self->{answerBox} = shift ||$self->{answerBox}; # replace the current contents if non-empty
00578     $self->{answerBox};
00579 }
00580 
00581 sub debugMode {
00582     my $self = shift;
00583     my $new_flag = shift;
00584     $self->{debugMode} = $new_flag if defined($new_flag);
00585     $self->{debugMode};
00586 }

00636 
00637 sub insertHeader {
00638     my $self = shift;
00639 
00640     my $codebase              =  $self->codebase;
00641     my $appletId              =  $self->appletId;
00642     my $appletName            =  $self->appletName;
00643     my $initializeActionAlias =  $self->initializeActionAlias;
00644     my $submitActionScript    =  $self->submitActionScript;
00645     my $setStateAlias         =  $self->setStateAlias;
00646     my $getStateAlias         =  $self->getStateAlias;
00647 
00648     my $setConfigAlias        =  $self->setConfigAlias;
00649     my $getConfigAlias        =  $self->getConfigAlias;
00650     my $maxInitializationAttempts = $self->maxInitializationAttempts;
00651     my $debugMode             =  ($self->debugMode) ? "1": "0";
00652     my $answerBoxAlias        =  $self->{answerBoxAlias};
00653     my $onInit                =  $self->{onInit};   # function to indicate that applet is loaded (for geogebra:   ggbOnInit
00654     my $headerText            =  $self->header();
00655     my $selfLoading           =  $self->{selfLoading};
00656     
00657     #$submitActionScript =~ s/"/\\"/g;    # escape quotes for ActionScript
00658                                          # other variables should not have quotes.
00659                                          
00660     $submitActionScript =~ s/\n/ /g;     # replace returns with spaces -- returns in the wrong spot can cause trouble with javaScript
00661     $submitActionScript =~ s/\r/ /g;     # replace returns with spaces -- returns can cause trouble
00662     my  $base64_submitActionScript =     encode_base64($submitActionScript);
00663     my $base64_configuration  =  encode_base64($self->configuration);
00664     my $base64_initialState   =  encode_base64($self->initialState);
00665  
00666     $base64_submitActionScript =~s/\n//g;
00667     $base64_initialState  =~s/\n//g;  # base64 encoded xml
00668     $base64_configuration =~s/\n//g;  # base64 encoded xml
00669     
00670     $headerText =~ s/(\$\w+)/$1/gee;   # interpolate variables p17 of Cookbook
00671   
00672     return $headerText;
00673 
00674 
00675 }

00679 # HEADER material for one flash or java applet

00682 use constant DEFAULT_HEADER_TEXT =><<'END_HEADER_SCRIPT';
00683     <script src="/webwork2_files/js/Base64.js" language="javascript">
00684     </script>   
00685     <script src="/webwork2_files/js/ww_applet_support.js" language="javascript">
00686         //upload functions stored in /opt/webwork/webwork2/htdocs/js ...
00687         
00688      </script>
00689     <script language="JavaScript">
00690     
00691      function getApplet(appletName) {
00692           var isIE = navigator.appName.indexOf("Microsoft") != -1;  // ie8 uses this for java and firefox uses it for flash.
00693           var obj = (isIE) ? window[appletName] : window.document[appletName];
00694           //return window.document[appletName];
00695           if (!obj) { obj = document.getElementById(appletName) }
00696           if (obj ) {   //RECENT FIX to ==
00697               return( obj );
00698           } else {
00699               alert ("can't find applet " + appletName);          
00700           }
00701       } 
00702         
00704     //TEST code
00705     //
00706     // 
00708    
00709     ww_applet_list["$appletName"]                  = new ww_applet("$appletName");
00710     
00711     
00712     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].code             = "$code";
00713     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].codebase         = "$codebase";
00714     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].appletID         = "$appletID";
00715     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].base64_state     = "$base64_initialState";
00716     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].initialState     =  Base64.decode("$base64_initialState");
00717     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].configuration    =  Base64.decode("$base64_configuration");;
00718     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].getStateAlias    = "$getStateAlias";
00719     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].setStateAlias    = "$setStateAlias";
00720     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].setConfigAlias   = "$setConfigAlias";
00721     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].getConfigAlias   = "$getConfigAlias";
00722     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].initializeActionAlias = "$initializeActionAlias";
00723     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].submitActionAlias = "$submitActionAlias";
00724     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].submitActionScript = Base64.decode("$base64_submitActionScript");
00725     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].answerBoxAlias     = "$answerBoxAlias";
00726     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].maxInitializationAttempts = $maxInitializationAttempts;
00727     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].debugMode          = "$debugMode";
00728     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].onInit             = "$onInit";   
00729 
00730 
00731     </script>
00732     
00733 END_HEADER_SCRIPT

00736 
00737 sub insertObject {
00738     my $self       = shift;
00739     my $code       = $self->{code};
00740     my $codebase   = $self->{codebase};
00741     my $appletId   = $self->{appletName};
00742     my $appletName = $self->{appletName};
00743     my $archive    = $self->{archive};
00744     my $width      = $self->{width};
00745     my $height     = $self->{height};
00746     my $applet_bgcolor = $self->{bgcolor};
00747     my $selfLoading = $self->{selfLoading};
00748     my $javaParameters = '';
00749     my $flashParameters = '';
00750     if (PGcore::not_null($self->{parameter_string}) ) {
00751         $javaParameters = $self->{parameter_string};
00752         $flashParameters = $self->{parameter_string};
00753     } else {
00754         my %param_hash = %{$self->params()};
00755         foreach my $key (keys %param_hash) {
00756             $javaParameters .= qq!<param name ="$key"  value = "$param_hash{$key}">\n!;
00757             $flashParameters .= uri_escape($key).'='.uri_escape($param_hash{$key}).'&';
00758         }
00759         $flashParameters =~ s/\&$//;    # trim last &
00760     }
00761 
00762    
00763     $objectText = $self->{objectText};
00764     $objectText =~ s/(\$\w+)/$1/gee;
00765     $objectText .=qq{<script language="javascript">ww_applet_list["$appletName"].visible = 1;</script>}; # don't submit things if not visible
00766     return $objectText;
00767 }
00768

00770 ###############################################################################################################
00771 #
00772 # FLASH APPLET  PACKAGE
00773 #
00774 ###############################################################################################################
00775 
00776 package FlashApplet;
00777 @ISA = qw(Applet);
00778 
00779 
00780 =head2 Insertion HTML code for FlashApplet
00781 
00782 =pod
00783 
00784 The secret to making this applet work with IE in addition to normal browsers
00785 is the addition of the C(<form></form>) construct just before the object.
00786 
00787 For some reason IE has trouble locating a flash object which is contained
00788 within a form.  Adding this second blank form with the larger problemMainForm
00789 seems to solve the problem.  
00790 
00791 This follows method2 of the advice given in url(http://kb.adobe.com/selfservice/viewContent.do?externalId=kb400730&sliceId=2)
00792 Method1 and methods involving SWFObject(Geoff Stearns) and SWFFormFix (Steve Kamerman) have yet to be fully investigated:
00793 http://devel.teratechnologies.net/swfformfix/swfobject_swfformfix_source.js
00794 http://www.teratechnologies.net/stevekamerman/index.php?m=01&y=07&entry=entry070101-033933
00795 
00796         use constant DEFAULT_OBJECT_TEXT =><<'END_OBJECT_TEXT';
00797           <form></form>
00798           <object classid="clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000"
00799                      id="$appletName" width="500" height="375"
00800                      codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab">
00801                  <param name="movie" value="$codebase/$appletName.swf" />
00802                  <param name="quality" value="high" />
00803                  <param name="bgcolor" value="$applet_bgcolor" />
00804                  <param name="allowScriptAccess" value="sameDomain" />
00805                  <embed src="$codebase/$appletName.swf" quality="high" bgcolor="$applet_bgcolor"
00806                      width="$width" height="$height" name="$appletName" align="middle" id="$appletName"
00807                      play="true" loop="false" quality="high" allowScriptAccess="sameDomain"
00808                      type="application/x-shockwave-flash"
00809                      pluginspage="http://www.macromedia.com/go/getflashplayer">
00810                  </embed>
00811         
00812              </object>
00813         END_OBJECT_TEXT
00814 
00815 
00816 =cut
00817 
00818 use constant DEFAULT_OBJECT_TEXT =><<'END_OBJECT_TEXT';
00819 
00820 
00821   <object classid="clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000" 
00822              id="$appletName"  width="500" height="375"
00823              codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab">
00824          <param name="movie" value="$codebase/$appletName.swf" />
00825          <param name="quality" value="high" />
00826          <param name="bgcolor" value="$applet_bgcolor" />
00827          <param name="allowScriptAccess" value="sameDomain" />
00828          <param name="FlashVars" value="$flashParameters"/>
00829          <embed src="$codebase/$appletName.swf" quality="high" bgcolor="$applet_bgcolor"
00830              width="$width" height="$height" name="$appletName"  align="middle" id="$appletName"
00831              play="true" loop="false" quality="high" allowScriptAccess="sameDomain"
00832              type="application/x-shockwave-flash"
00833              pluginspage="http://www.macromedia.com/go/getflashplayer"
00834              FlashVars="$flashParameters">
00835          </embed>
00836 
00837      </object>
00838 END_OBJECT_TEXT
00839 
00840 sub new {
00841     my $class = shift;
00842     $class -> SUPER::new(   objectText   => DEFAULT_OBJECT_TEXT(),
00843                             type         => 'flash',
00844                             @_
00845     );
00846 
00847 }

00855 package JavaApplet;

00858 =head2 Insertion HTML code for JavaApplet
00859 
00860 =pod
00861 
00862 The secret to making this applet work with IE in addition to normal browsers
00863 is the addition of the C(<form></form>) construct just before the object.
00864 
00865 For some reason IE has trouble locating a flash object which is contained
00866 within a form.  Adding this second blank form with the larger problemMainForm
00867 seems to solve the problem.  
00868 
00869 This follows method2 of the advice given in url(http://kb.adobe.com/selfservice/viewContent.do?externalId=kb400730&sliceId=2)
00870 Method1 and methods involving SWFObject(Geoff Stearns) and SWFFormFix (Steve Kamerman) have yet to be fully investigated:
00871 http://devel.teratechnologies.net/swfformfix/swfobject_swfformfix_source.js
00872 http://www.teratechnologies.net/stevekamerman/index.php?m=01&y=07&entry=entry070101-033933
00873 
00874         use constant DEFAULT_OBJECT_TEXT =><<'END_OBJECT_TEXT';
00875          <applet
00876             code     = "$code"
00877             codebase = "$codebase"
00878             archive  = "$archive"
00879             name     = "$appletName"
00880             id       = "$appletName"
00881             width    = "$width"
00882             height   = "$height"
00883             MAYSCRIPT
00884          >
00885           $javaParameters
00886          </applet>
00887         END_OBJECT_TEXT
00888 
00889 =cut
00890 
00891 
00892 =pod
00893 
00894 use constant DEFAULT_OBJECT_TEXT =><<'END_OBJECT_TEXT';
00895 
00896  <applet
00897     code     = "$code"
00898     codebase = "$codebase"
00899     archive  = "$archive"
00900     name     = "$appletName"
00901     id       = "$appletName"
00902     width    = "$width"
00903     height   = "$height"
00904     bgcolor  = "$applet_bgcolor"
00905     mayscript = "true";
00906  >
00907   $javaParameters
00908   
00909   Sorry, the Applet could not be started. Please make sure that
00910 Java 1.4.2 (or later) is installed and activated. 
00911 (<a href="http://java.sun.com/getjava">click here to install Java now</a>)
00912  </applet>
00913 END_OBJECT_TEXT
00914 
00915 =cut

00923      id       = "$appletName"
00924      name     = "$appletName"
00925     code      = "$code"
00926      type     = "application/x-java-applet"

00968 The secret to making this applet work with IE in addition to normal browsers
00969 is the addition of the C(<form></form>) construct just before the object.
00970 
00971 For some reason IE has trouble locating a flash object which is contained
00972 within a form.  Adding this second blank form with the larger problemMainForm
00973 seems to solve the problem.  
00974 
00975 This follows method2 of the advice given in url(http://kb.adobe.com/selfservice/viewContent.do?externalId=kb400730&sliceId=2)
00976 Method1 and methods involving SWFObject(Geoff Stearns) and SWFFormFix (Steve Kamerman) have yet to be fully investigated:
00977 http://devel.teratechnologies.net/swfformfix/swfobject_swfformfix_source.js
00978 http://www.teratechnologies.net/stevekamerman/index.php?m=01&y=07&entry=entry070101-033933

00980 use constant CANVAS_OBJECT_TEXT =><<'END_OBJECT_TEXT';
00981   <form></form>
00982     <script> var width = 200; var height = 200;</script>
00983     <canvas name="cv" id="cv" data-src="http://localhost/webwork2_files/js/sketchgraphhtml5b/SketchGraph.pjs" width="400" height="400"></canvas>  
00984 END_OBJECT_TEXT
00985

00988 =cut

00991 use constant CANVAS_OBJECT_HEADER_TEXT =><<'END_HEADER_SCRIPT';
00992     <script src="/webwork2_files/js/Base64.js" language="javascript">
00993     </script>   
00994     <script src="/webwork2_files/js/ww_applet_support.js" language="javascript">
00995         //upload functions stored in /opt/webwork/webwork2/htdocs/js ...
00996         
00997      </script>
00998     <script language="JavaScript">
00999     
01000 
01001         
01003     //CANVAS OBJECT HEADER CODE
01004     // 
01006    
01007     ww_applet_list["$appletName"] = new ww_applet("$appletName");
01008     
01009     
01010     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].code             = "$code";
01011     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].codebase         = "$codebase";
01012     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].appletID         = "$appletID";
01013     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].base64_state     = "$base64_initializationState";
01014     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].initialState     = Base64.decode("$base64_initialState");
01015     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].configuration    = Base64.decode("$base64_configuration");;
01016     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].getStateAlias    = "$getStateAlias";
01017     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].setStateAlias    = "$setStateAlias";
01018     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].setConfigAlias   = "$setConfigAlias";
01019     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].getConfigAlias   = "$getConfigAlias";
01020     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].initializeActionAlias = "$initializeActionAlias";
01021     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].submitActionAlias = "$submitActionAlias";
01022     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].submitActionScript = Base64.decode("$base64_submitActionScript");
01023     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].answerBoxAlias = "$answerBoxAlias";
01024     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].maxInitializationAttempts = $maxInitializationAttempts;
01025     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].debugMode = "$debugMode"; 
01026     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].debugMode = "$selfLoading";
01027 
01028     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].reportsLoaded = 1;
01029     ww_applet_list["$appletName"].object = $appletName;
01030     
01031     function getApplet(appletName) {
01032           //var isIE = navigator.appName.indexOf("Microsoft") != -1;
01033           //var obj = (isIE) ? window[appletName] : window.document[appletName];
01034           //return window.document[appletName];
01035           var obj = ww_applet_list[appletName].object;   // define fake applet for this object
01036           if (obj && (obj.name == appletName)) {   //RECENT FIX to ==
01037               //alert("getting fake applet " + obj.name);
01038               return( obj );
01039           } else {
01040               alert ("can't find fake applet " + appletName + " in object "+obj.name);        
01041           }
01042       } 
01043     </script>
01044     
01045 END_HEADER_SCRIPT
01046

01049 
01050 
01051 use constant CANVAS_OBJECT_TEXT =><<'END_OBJECT_TEXT';
01052     <script language="javascript">ww_applet_list["$appletName"].visible = 1; // don't submit things if not visible
01053     </script>
01054     <canvas name="cv" id="cv" data-src="/webwork2_files/js/sketchgraphhtml5b/SketchGraph.pjs" width="$width" height="$height"></canvas>  
01055 END_OBJECT_TEXT
01056 
01057 sub new {
01058     my $class = shift;
01059     $class -> SUPER::new(   objectText   => CANVAS_OBJECT_TEXT(),
01060                             headerText   => CANVAS_OBJECT_HEADER_TEXT(),
01061                             type         => 'html5canvas',
01062                             @_
01063     );
01064 
01065 }
